Hey all, new to the community and not sure of the best channel for this (someone please point me in the right direction if there is a suitable one).

My team and I are in the process of setting up the HubSpot chat widget on our site, both for visitors to our public website and a subset of users within our app. Our pre-existing chat was through Intercom, and we have the chat widget embedded within menus and navbars as opposed to having it in it's native bubble state. We've managed to do the same with the HubSpot widget, and we have set it up so that the widget loads by default but doesn't open by default. We have also made use of the `unreadConversationCountChanged` event field to auto-open the chat when a message has been received and not yet seen; however, this only works to open the chat when the message is sent from the conversations inbox, not from a chatflow.

We want to be able to auto-open the chat when any message (including a new chatflow message) is waiting, does anyone have any suggestions, or any experience doing something similar?

Hello,

So we've been using the "Deal Owner" field (field type=HubSpot user) in some of our use-cases, to fetch and display the email address/full name of the user into communication.
However, one of our most important scenario is having the phone number of the deal owner stored on the deal level. (Noting that i can' find the phone number personalization for HubSpot users, most probably doesn't exist).

What would be the best way to have the phone number of the user assigned in the property "Deal owner" stored inside the deal itself?
If deal owner is X, display X's phone number in a field on the deal.

We have a big list of people that can be set as deal owners, Not feasible to do through workflow if branches as it will take ages and a lot of maintenance as we go forward.

Thanks!

We've built an API integration with HubSpot and I wrongly assumed that a permanently deleted contact won't be made available via the Contacts API, even when `archived=true` but that's not the case and now I need to find a way to update a simple field (first name) on this record (or restore it update it and then delete it).

Any help is greatly appreciated.

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
